ygData.messageBody:
At 01:13 AM 05/27/1999 +0200, you wrote:
>From: Wizard <wizard@...>
>
>At 13.32 26/05/99 -0500, you wrote:
>>From: Dan Alexander <dalex@...>
>>
>>These are very good ideas - I like them a lot. Instead of Haste though,
>>I'd like to see Shadowstep become a Line-of-sight teleport spell (as
>>someone on the list suggested earlier), and use that as our
>>travelling/exploring spell.
>
>I like this also but right now i think about you teleport right near sand
>giant wich you cannot see as you were to long way from him.


Good point. This would encourage wizards to make smaller hops, rather than
long hops.
Smaller hops would cover less territory per casting - mean using more mana
but with
relative safty, and longer hops would cover more terratory per casting -
conserving
mana but may get you into trouble with the local wildlife.

I think it would fit with our character class too. Running (even running
FAST) is just
so physical. You get sweaty. And really, sweat-stained wizard robes would
look pertty
disgusting on a high elf =) (I'm planning to wash the "dingy white
robes" as soon as I
can lay hands on them. =)

-Pennaggolan, 3rd Circle Wizard of Felwithe
(And a snappy dresser, too!)
